info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 12:01PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS ARE DEVELOPING ACROSS SEVERAL COUNTIES IN SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. INDIVIDUAL THUNDERSTORMS MAY BECOME STRONG AND PRODUCE WIND GUSTS TO 40 MPH, SMALL HAIL, VERY HEAVY RAINFALL, AND FREQUENT CLOUD-TO-GROUND LIGHTNING. THE STORMS WILL GENERALLY MOVE NORTHWARD AROUND 20 MPH. At 1157 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of scattered strong thunderstorms from northwest North Carolina, including Ashe and Alleghany counties northeast to Montgomery County VA. Other counties included within this advisory are Wilkes and Surry counties in North Carolina and Grayson, Carroll, Floyd, Wythe, Pulaski, and Giles counties in southwest Virginia as well as the independent city of Galax in southwest Virginia. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail with the stronger storms. Frequent dangerous cloud-to-ground lightning. Very heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Dangerous lightning strikes. Minor flooding. Locations impacted include... Blacksburg... Christiansburg... Radford... Pulaski... Wytheville... Galax... and Elkin. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
